page.title: 13FARMING - IDEN GREEN CONT...
page.content: {WOODS:}A lot of trees in gullies have been cut down. Pookwell Wood has been destroyed in 1985. Moor Wood and Standen Wood are managed woodlands, used for game bird cover and coppicing. {ARABLE}LAND 50% of fields approx are for cereals, oats, wheat, barley and small amount of rape introduced in the last two years of the remaining 50% approx.one third are for grazing cattle and one third for sheep. {DAIRY FARMING:}Sizes of herds have been much reduced because of E.E.C. restrictions on milk production. {HOPS:}There are two hop gardens in Iden Green hamlet. Extensive gardens (815296). NEW ENTERPRISES:{Trout fishing}and a fishing school is flourishing near Ranters Oak after ponds were dug and stocked with fish. Vines are new too.
